result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample if not already provided.  Undergo any counseling/treatment to include Anger Management and Domestic Abuse per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Mental health evaluation and treatment recommendations per agent.  To continue mental health treatment and medications as recommended per agent.

records.addlTxt:
03:38 PM Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in custody.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Parties rec/rev revocation summary.  No corrections to be noted other than possible jail credit.  Court notes letters rec'd from P.A., P.W. and D.C.  State has received and reviewed those.  No victim impact issues in this case to be noted.  Atty Covey has two of DE's supporters in the courtroom and they don't wish to say anything on the record.  State makes recommendations.  Atty Covey makes statement.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Attorneys to do written stipulation re: credit.

Cts 3 and 4: 
6 years prison 
(3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision) 
Concurrent to each other and any other sentence
Conditions of extended supervision:
All types of counseling deemed appropriate per agent to include anger management counseling, domestic abuse counseling and any other counseling per agent
Mental health evaluation and treatment recommendations per agent
To continue mental health treatment and medications as recommended per agent
DE is not eligible for ERP or CIP

ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy Michael Christensen
Current: PO Box 700, #439615, Waupun, WI 53963-0700 United States  (Effective: 11-16-2018)
Prior: S7559 Us Highway 12 Lot O-19, North Freedom, WI 53951
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 11, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Adjustment Number: 18A 015958, Payable Number: 211941, Receipt Number: 18R 023376, Amount: $20.00

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State states matter is resolved and DE will plead to Ct 3 and Ct 4 w/remaining counts being dismissed/read-in.  Atty Lawton agrees w/recs as stated and DE will waive prelim.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty Lawton acknowledges rec. information/waives reading.  Atty Lawton enters NC pleas to Ct 3 and 4.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Counts 1, 2, 5 and 6 are dismissed/read-in.  Parties make brief argument.  DE makes brief statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of felony firearm warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

Cts 1, 2, 5 and 6:  Dismissed/read-in
Cts 3 and 4:  NC
3 years probation concurrent to each other but consecutive to sentence DE is currently serving
Conditions of probation:
Costs/surcharges of $618.00 x 2 to be paid per agent during term of probation
DNA sample to be provided unless one has previously been provided
AODA/Treatment/Anger Management/Domestic Abuse Counseling and any other counseling per agent

Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen appears upstairs in court holding with attorney Melville Peter Middleton appearing in person.  Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states case and appearances.  Atty Middleton states DE told him 5 minutes ago that he wants to fire him as counsel.  Court security states DE is in custody but doesn't want to come down or court.  Court grants oral motion by Atty Middleton to withdraw and DE doesn't need to be brought down.  Atty Middleton to provide written order for the Court to sign.  Prelim to be reset when new counsel is appointed for DE.  Atty Middleton states he'll notify his office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on April 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on March 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton notes he just got an expert and will need time.  Requests 30 days.  State agrees.  Court resets/bond continued.  Status hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Fax'd Cover Letter from WI Forensic Unit
Status hearing on February 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen appeared by video means with Attorney Dolch for Attorney Middleton.  Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton would request to raise competency.  Request comp evaluation on in patient basis.  State does not object.  Court appoints for an inpatient competency evaluation.  Time limits continued to be waived.  Clerk to draft order for signature.
Return date on January 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.   Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case will resolve so need reset.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim appears in person.  Request telephone contact and contact at the LEC.  State's position remains the same.  Objection to any modification.  No objection to the jail handling transferring of title issues.  Court calls victim, H.C., sworn by the court & testifies.  Request contact due to upcoming birth of child.   State gives final statement.  Attorney Steinman gives final statement.  Contact at the jail should be allowed.  Court allows contact while defendant is in custody only.  Court also allows contact via writing, mail.
Motion hearing on December 8, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Pre-trial conference on December 19, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Return date on December 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy Michael Christensen appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. State request $2500.00 cash with conditions.  Attorney ORourke request lesser cash bond.  No objection to the no contact.  Defendant is employed.  Advised rights to an attorney. Time limits waived. $2500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with H.C., her residence or her children.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 08:45 am.  Return date scheduled for December 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
